content.question: Which of the following statements correctly identifies which compound, pentane or propanoic acid, has the higher boiling point and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: Pentane, because it has greater London dispersion forces than propanoic acid does
Pentane, because it can form more hydrogen bonds per molecule than propanoic acid can
Propanoic acid, because double bonds are harder to break than single bonds
Propanoic acid, because it forms hydrogen bonds, whereas pentane does not

content.answer: Propanoic acid, because it forms hydrogen bonds, whereas pentane does not

skill.text: 6.E: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using connections between particulate and macroscopic scales or levels.
